So got a question... originally started with the 1.61d loader by Hazar, using the SLIC method, and worked fine for a while until I reformatted in order to reinstall Windows 7 a bit ago.  Switched to this loader, and worked without a hitch for maybe three weeks before it started complaining that it wasn't genuine any longer.  So, used loader again, fixed it... warning came back two days later.  So, basically, the patch works, but it only seems to last an average of one to two days before I have to run it again.  Have tried both the SLIC method and the loader method, both seem to work just as well for the same amount of time.  Anything I'm doing wrong or is anyone else having this problem?

Forgot to mention... one idea I have is that maybe there is some service I have disabled that would need to remain enabled in order for the loader/activation to work?  I am fairly minimalist and disable a lot of the unnecessary services, done a lot of research on their dependencies but its possible I could have overlooked something.

DO NOT INSTALL WINDOWS UPDATE KB971033 if you use this to crack Windows 7. See http://www.buzzcrunch.net/2010/02/windows-7-update-kb971033/  And if you have installed it you have to remove it in the control panel then use removeWAT (search on TPB) and you'll be back up and running.

If you installed the update KB971033 just do this. Use the loader to do the bios hack then click the key in the bottom right of your task bar. When the box pops up, click the button in the middle and it'll take you to the microsoft genuine advantage. Click the green button that says continue, download it and then run it. After you run it, click on the next green button under the first one that says continue. It'll then validate your installation and you should be good from there on out. I stumbled onto this by accident. I was going to close out the box that popped up but click the button in the middle by mistake and just went with it.

HERE IS THE INFO ON THE WINDOWS UPDATE
KB971033
http://www.geekmontage.com/how-to-uninstall-windows-7-activation-update-kb971033/

This crack works, but it adds you to a botnet.  If you do a netstat -na (in a command window) you'll see lots of UDP:*.* entries.  I did a Fresh install from an SH1 mstech verified Windows7 Ultimate iso image.  I ran tcpdump on my FreeBSD firewall box and then installed this... all of a sudden there are hundreds, if not thousands of UDP connections going in and out of my Windows install.  I don't know if you are ignorant of this hellboy, but if you do know, then you can go to hell.  I'm not some newb.  I have a tcpdump file to prove it.  I feel sorry for all the people that ran this.  Now I had to reinstall and sure as shit this clean install doesn't have any hundreds of UDP connections being made every minute.
